Humphrey Metrodome]] | City = [[Minneapolis, Minnesota]] | Visitor School = Malone University | Visitor Name Short = Malone | Visitor Nickname = Pioneers | Visitor Record = 6-3 | Visitor Coach = [[Mike Gardner (football coach)|Mike Gardner]] | Visitor1 = 7 | Visitor2 = 21 | Visitor3 = 7 | Visitor4 = 9 | Home School = Northwestern College (Minnesota) | Home Name Short = Northwestern | Home Nickname = Eagles | Home Record = 8-2 | Home Coach = Kirk Talley | Home1 = 7 | Home2 = 14 | Home3 = 14 | Home4 = 14 | MVP = Offensive: Zach Tarter (Northwestern)
Defensive: Wesley Kauffman (Malone) | Odds = | Anthem = | Referee = | Halftime = | Attendance = 1,421 | Payout = | US Network = | US Announcers = | Ratings = }} The '''2008 [[Victory Bowl]]''' is a [[college football]] post-season [[bowl game]]. The game was played on November 21, 2008 at the [[Hubert H. Humphrey Metrodome]] in [[Minneapolis, Minnesota]].[http://www.thenccaa.org/victorybowlchamp.htm National Christian College Athletic Association] Victory Bowl Invitational The [[2008 Malone Pioneers football team|Malone Pioneers]][http://www.cantonrep.com/index.php?ID=441873&Category=17&subCategoryID=30 Canton Repository] "Malone headed to Victory Bowl" November 18, 2008 from the [[National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics|NAIA]] played against [[NCAA]] Division III {{cfb link|year=2008|team=Northwestern Eagles football|title=Northwestern Eagles}}.[http://www.nwceagles.com/sports/2008/11/16/FB_1116085139.aspx Northwestern College Athletics] NCAA Victory Bowl XII Malone failed to defend their title as the [[2007 Victory Bowl]] winners on their third consecutive trip to the bowl.[http://www.cantonrep.com/index.php?ID=442192&Category=17&subCategoryID=30 Canton Repository] "Malone to defend Victory Bowl title" by Mike Popovich, November 20, 2008 Northwestern's win was their second Victory Bowl championship and fourth appearance[http://www.ohio.com/sports/34861144.html Akron Beacon Journal] "Malone football scouting report" November 21, 2008 in the game's twelve-year history. == Game summary == [[Northwestern College (Minnesota)|Northwestern]] and [[2008 Malone Pioneers football team|Malone University]] scored a combined 93 points as the Eagles from Northwestern claimed a 49-44 win. The contest was closely competed and it was not until under a minute remaining was the gameâs outcome decided. Malone held a 28-14 lead midway through the second quarter, but after that the point differential remained within seven points or less until Northwesternâs Ty Crabtree ran an interception 50 yards for the Eaglesâ final score of the game.[http://www.thenccaa.org/victorybowlchamp.htm NCCAA] 2008 Victory Bowl == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.thenccaa.org/victorybowl.htm Victory Bowl at the NCCAA website] * [http://newjourneyphotography.smugmug.com/gallery/6604139_RsJH3#420825819_Qhuvx 2008 Victory Bowl Photos] {{Victory Bowl navbox}} [[Category:Victory Bowl]] [[Category:Malone Pioneers football bowl games]] [[Category:Northwestern Eagles football bowl games]] [[Category:2008 NAIA football season|Victory Bowl]] [[Category:2008 NCAA Division III football season|Victory Bowl]]
